features: 360-DEGREE SPINNER MANEUVERABLITY: Propped on 4 wheels and a locking retractable handle, take advantage of its easy pushing and pulling maneuverability to seamlessly get through a crowded airport or down narrow airplane isles.

FULL FEATURED INTERIOR: Equipped with a fully lined interior, maximize packing efficiency with multiple interior packing pockets, and adjustable tie down straps to help keep clothing in place while on the move.
MULTIPLE FRONT PANEL POCKETS: Exterior front panel features two front zip compartments to organize travel essentials required while traveling as well as last-minute add-in items.
LIGHTWEIGHT LIFT HANDLE: Comfortable lightweight top lift handle for easy lifting and maneuvering without the bulk.
PRODUCT DIMENSIONS (including wheels and handles): Carry-On: 21.5” x 15” x 9” 5.7 lbs; Checked-Medium: 26.75” x 16.25” x 11” 6.45 lbs; Checked-Large: 31” x 19.25” x 12.75” 8.35 lbs
body.description: Get away in confidence with the SwissGear 4010 Spinner collection. This sophisticated looking luggage collection comes equipped with a rugged locking retractable handle, lightweight lift handles, and four lightweight 360-degree multi-directional spinner wheels for the ultimate in maneuverability. Constructed of abrasion-resistant polyester fabric, other features include adjustable clothing tie-down straps, multiple internal pockets, and two front storage pockets for last-minute additions.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 4, 2023
reviews.reviewText: We bought this bag as the perfect intermediate between our carry-ons and the giant 24 or 26 inch bags we’d been taking on trips. It works great in that role. We’ve only used it a couple of times, but the spinner wheels work great and seem solid enough. The compartments are well designed and the zippers work well. Won’t be able to comment on overall durability until we’ve used it for a few more trips, but so far, so good.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 4, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Solid carry-on fits easily into overhead compartments
reviews.reviewText: Very light weight. Wheels work great. Handle isn't quite as sturdy as I'd like, but gets the job done. Easy to swivel and rotate the bag as it rolls along. Fits in overhead compartments on planes with room to spare. Handle makes it easy to get in and out. Zippered compartments on the front are an added bonus. Would recommend!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 31, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars As described and fast.
reviews.reviewText: Great transaction/seller 5/5 stars but SwissGear quality has gone noticeably down over the years. I bought this same item a decade ago and it still looks better than the new ones I’ve seen.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 18, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Surprisingly small but roomy
reviews.reviewText: Smaller than usual carryon but valid for international travel. Well made and roomy.Outside pockets for laptop or iPad. Sturdy and very maneuverable.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 23, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Tough, Lightweight Traveler
reviews.reviewText: A Tough, Lightweight Traveler… I did a lot of research before selecting the SwissGear 4010 Soft-side Carry-on, 360-degree spinner, 18 inches. First and foremost, it met the size requirement for European airlines and having owned several SwissGear products, I knew I could count on the quality. I was a little concerned that instead of eight wheels it had only four, but this little guy handled almost all the airport bumps with no problem and stood up to the rough tiled streets of Lisbon with aplomb. There was plenty of room inside, and I was even able to fit in an extra pair of shoes and folded sportscoat. Also, it’s very lightweight and easy to lift into the overhead compartment. The only issue I had (which I noted in some reviews) was the ratcheting handle sometimes wouldn’t always stay in place, but this was not a deal-breaker. This IS a carry-on, and I wouldn’t check it with any expectations of it coming through unscathed. All in all, I’m very pleased with my purchase.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 25, 2023
Reviewed in the United States on September 27, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect size and seems to be good quality
reviews.reviewText: I had a very large and a very small suitcase but had been looking for something in the middle. I looked at various products but there are not many options for the middle. This size was perfect and it held up well during its first trip. It has some nice features like an inside pocket and wheels that roll easily. I also like the telescopic handle which is also a good height for me.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 22, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Don’t buy. Handle unstable & badly engineered
reviews.reviewText: Just took this light weight small roll on (despite not having a side handle to facilitate lifting) on a two week trip abroad. Since it was carry on, it was always with me. The handle never held its position once pulled out of the suitcase. This handle doesn’t lock in place and stay there. It slips up and down, even on escalators, when moving on uneven surfaces. Honestly, traveling means carrying another bag, packages etc. and if the roll on is unstable it’s dangerous. Especially getting on and off escalators, going down curbs, rushing to catch trains etc. Very disappointed. It was exhausting adjusting this handle and to remember not to let my hand tough the release button right on top of the handle, that cause it to go up and down. Because that’s the only place meant to adjust the height of the handle. I have lots of roll ons and suitcases. Never have I had one this unstable. Frankly, don’t buy this. You’ll fight with it on every trip.

reviews.reviewTitle: Es de muy buena calidad y ligera ampliamente la recomiendo
reviews.reviewText: Hermosa y super practica no pesa es muy ligera

The good: this fit perfectly for air Transat carry on specs (and she made us try it in the caddy)… it fit well.The bad: we bought two, and one had a faulty handle that kept jamming up or down… it was such a pain!The case is quite small and my personal item on top kept tipping it over. But it was fine when in motion and I was holding it up.

La devolví, porque no es tan robusta como otras. Tiene pocos remaches en las agarraderas, así que no se ve muy sólida. No es mala, pero no es lo que esperaba. Me sorprendió, porque es mi primera maleta SwissGear que no se ve de construcción fuerte.

This carry-on is the perfect size for the tight WestJet restrictions, and it fits in the sizer no problem! It is quite small, but I was somehow able to squeeze 7 days of clothes in here and didn't even need to check a bag. It moves around well (the wheels are 360 degrees), and it was super comfortable to pull along with me through the airport.

Holds lots for a 7days trip. Fits well in the overhead cabin. Part of the stitch was undone though but was too late to return as my trip was literally the next day. The one I bought for my husband was ok.
